title: Using ERK palettes and themes
text: erk erksemi erklight   can choose discrete continuous palettes. Continuous values interpolated based desired number output colors
code: display_all(override.order = FALSE) display_all(override.order = TRUE) erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 3, type = "discrete") erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 15, type = "continuous") # fails tryCatch(      erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 15, type = "discrete"),       error = function(e) print(e) ) #> <simpleError in erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk", n = 15, type = "discrete"): Number of requested colors greater than what discrete palette can offer,  #>  use continuous instead.>   pal <- erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 3, type = "discrete") str(pal) #>  'palette' chr [1:3] "#de3614" "#823d1c" "#964d80" #>  - attr(*, "name")= chr "erk"

title: Using ERK palettes and themes
code: pal_3_cols <- erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 3, type = "discrete", override.order = FALSE) str(pal_3_cols) #>  'palette' chr [1:3] "#de3614" "#823d1c" "#964d80" #>  - attr(*, "name")= chr "erk"  plot(iris$Sepal.Length, iris$Sepal.Width, col = pal_3_cols[ unclass(iris$Species) ], pch = 16, cex = 1.5) pal_3_cols <- erk.brewer(palette_name = "erk",n = 7, type = "discrete", override.order = TRUE)[1:3]  plot(iris$Sepal.Length, iris$Sepal.Width, col = pal_3_cols[ unclass(iris$Species) ], pch = 16, cex = 1.5)

previous_headings: Available palettes > Using palettes with ggplot2
title: Using ERK palettes and themes
text: Setting override.order TRUE yields better results fewer categories.
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Species)) +   geom_point() +   # better with fewer colors   scale_color_erk_d(palette_name = "erk", override.order = TRUE) sectors <- c("Energy", "Transportation", "LULUCF") mock_data <- data.frame(sector = factor(sectors, levels = rev(sectors)),                         values = c(100, 70, -30))   cols <- erk.brewer("erk", 7)[c(1,4,7)] names(cols) <- mock_data[[ "sector" ]]   ggplot(mock_data, aes(x = values, y = sector, fill = sector)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   scale_fill_manual(values = cols)

previous_headings: Available palettes > Using palettes with ggplot2
title: Using ERK palettes and themes
code: library(ggplot2)  ggplot(iris, aes(x = Sepal.Length, y = Sepal.Width, color = Petal.Length)) +   geom_point() +   # better with fewer colors   scale_color_erk_c(palette_name = "erk")

title: Using ERK palettes and themes
code: sectors <- c("Energy", "Transportation", "LULUCF") mock_data <- data.frame(sector = factor(sectors, levels = sectors),                         values = c(100, 70, -30))   cols <- erk.brewer("erk", 7)[c(1,4,7)] names(cols) <- mock_data[[ "sector" ]]   ggplot(mock_data, aes(x = sector, y = values, fill = sector)) +   geom_bar(stat = "identity") +   scale_fill_manual(values = cols) +   theme_erk()

title: Authors and Citation
text: Alexander Hurley. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Hurley (2023). erkolor: Color Palettes ERK. https://github.com/-Hull/erkolor, https://-hull.github.io/erkolor/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {erkolor: Color Palettes of the ERK},   author = {Alexander Hurley},   year = {2023},   note = {https://github.com/the-Hull/erkolor, https://the-hull.github.io/erkolor/}, }

title: Color Palettes of the ERK
text: goal erkolor provide quick interface ERK CI style.

title: Color Palettes of the ERK
text: can install development version erkolor GitHub :
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("the-Hull/erkolor")

title: Color Palettes of the ERK
code: library(erkolor) display_all(override.order = FALSE) display_all(override.order = TRUE)

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
text: Function viewing palettes available erkolor.

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
code: display_all(   n,   sequential = FALSE,   colorblind_only = FALSE,   direction = 1,   override.order = FALSE )

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
text: n Number requested colors. n left blank, default palette returned. sequential palettes displayed , one time. Default (FALSE). colorblind_only colorblind friendly palettes returned? Default set FALSE. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability aesthetics. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE.

title: View all Palettes available — display_all
code: # All Palettes display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = FALSE) #> Error in display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = FALSE): unused argument (colorblind_only = FALSE)  # All Colorblind Palettes display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = TRUE) #> Error in display_all(sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = TRUE): unused argument (colorblind_only = TRUE)  # 5 Colors of all Palettes display_all(5, sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = FALSE) #> Error in display_all(5, sequential = FALSE, colorblind_only = FALSE): unused argument (colorblind_only = FALSE)

title: ERK Palette Generator — erk.brewer
text: Color palettes based ERK CI Style Guide Use colorblind.friendly check whether palettes colorblind-friendly.

title: ERK Palette Generator — erk.brewer
code: erk.brewer(   palette_name,   n,   type = c("discrete", "continuous"),   direction = c(1, -1),   override.order = FALSE )

title: ERK Palette Generator — erk.brewer
text: n Number desired colors. number requested colors beyond scope palette, colors automatically interpolated. n provided, length palette used. type Either "continuous" "discrete". Use continuous want automatically interpolate colors. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability aesthetics. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE. palette Name Palette. Choices : erk, erksemi, erklight

title: ERK Palette Generator — erk.brewer
text: vector colors.

title: ERK Palette Generator — erk.brewer
code: erk.brewer("erksemi")   erk.brewer("erklight", direction=-1)   erk.brewer("erk", 4, override.order=TRUE)   library(ggplot2) ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Species, y=Petal.Length, fill=Species)) + geom_violin() + scale_fill_manual(values=erk.brewer("erk", 3))   ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Sepal.Length, y=Sepal.Width, color=Species)) + geom_point(size=2) + scale_color_manual(values=erk.brewer("erk", 3))   ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Species, y=Sepal.Width, color=Sepal.Width)) + geom_point(size=3) + scale_color_gradientn(colors=erk.brewer("erk"))

title: Complete list of palettes. — erkPalettes
text: Use names(erkPalettes) return possible palette names. Current choices : erk, erksemi, erklight. Use erk.brewer construct palettes.

title: Complete list of palettes. — erkPalettes
code: erkPalettes

title: Complete list of palettes. — erkPalettes
text: object class list length 3.

what: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_c
title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_c
text: Function using erkolor colors schemes ggplot2. Use scale_color_erk_d scale_fill_erk_d discrete scales scale_color_erk_c scale_fill_erk_c continuous scales.

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_c
code: scale_color_erk_c(palette_name, direction = 1, ...)

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_c
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : erk, erksemi, erklight. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed ... arguments passed scale_color_gradientn

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_c
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Sepal.Length, y=Sepal.Width, color=Sepal.Length)) + geom_point() + scale_color_erk_c("Isfahan1", direction=-1) #> Error in erk.brewer(palette_name = palette_name, direction = direction,     override.order = F): Palette does not exist.

what: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_d
title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_d
text: Function using erkolor colors schemes ggplot2. Use scale_color_erk_d scale_fill_erk_d discrete scales scale_color_erk_c scale_fill_erk_c continuous scales.

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_d
code: scale_color_erk_d(palette_name, direction = 1, override.order = FALSE, ...)

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_d
text: palette_name Name Palette. Choices : #' erk, erksemi, erklight. direction Sets order colors. Default palette 1. direction -1, palette color order reversed override.order Colors picked palette maximize readability aesthetics. means colors always selected sequential order full palette. override.order set TRUE, colors selected sequential order full palette instead. Default FALSE. ... arguments passed discrete_scale

title: erkolor palettes for plotting with ggplot2 — scale_color_erk_d
code: library(ggplot2) ggplot(data=iris, aes(x=Sepal.Length, y=Sepal.Width, color=Species)) + geom_point() + scale_color_erk_d("Juarez") #> Error in erk.brewer.disc(palette_name = palette_name, direction = direction,     override.order = override.order): Palette does not exist.

title: ERK Theme — theme_erk
text: ERK Theme

title: ERK Theme — theme_erk
code: theme_erk(base_family = "sans", base_size = 10)

title: ERK Theme — theme_erk
text: base_family 'sans', 'serif', 'mono' installed font, like 'Open Sans Light' base_size numeric, defaults 10 points.

title: ERK Theme — theme_erk
text: ggproto object
